metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000116 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
NET-SNMP version 5.7.2 contains a heap corruption vulnerability in the UDPprotocol handler that can result in command execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
libsnmp30 - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
python-netsnmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
snmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
snmpd - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
tkmib - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1').
